p: Peanuts are a nutrient rich plant-based protein source that contain vitamins, minerals, antioxidants and bioactive phytochemicals, leading to the perception that peanuts are a “super food” [ 19]. Peanut phytosterols have been shown to help lower LDL cholesterol by competing in the digestive tract with cholesterol and preventing absorption [ 20]. One of the major phytosterols, stigmasterol, has been investigated for its pharmacological importance as an antihypercholesterolemic, anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, hypoglycemic and antitumor effector [ 21, 22]. In this study, it is reported that the kernel contains a higher percentage of stigmasterol as compared to the heart and seed coat. Different manufacturing processes may remove the seed coat or heart, so it is beneficial to the health of the consumer that the kernel possess relatively high concentrations of stigmasterol.
